instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00923A: What is 820-00923A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: MBP <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> shuts down suddenly
threads.message:
Hello. Rookie question - please tell med if further info is needed. 
I need help with mbp 2017 tb (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 829-00923-A) The story is as follows; Mbp is handed over because it shuts down in use. Takes after shut down 0.040 amp and 20 volts. If I remove the battery and start it, it boots normally and works for a while. But shuts down again. The fault is periodic and there are no short circuits. I have replaced the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> controllers (thunderbolt ROM <CHIP>U8090</CHIP>…) on both sides, but the same error continues. I have measured most through, but found no errors. I have two logicboards with the same error. Does anyone know of a solution or an idea for where to start searching? <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> has not been reballed/changed but this is my next attempt. Battery replaced with a new one - same problem. The mbp was handed over with af exploded battery.
Greetings from Morten


Gre

threads.title: MBP <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> shuts down suddenly
threads.message:
Did you test with known good battery?
If still shuts down, then no reason to touch USB-C area.

Does it turn off starting in SMC bypass mode?
Try your USB test macOS too.

Clean ME BIOS worth to try also.

threads.title: MBP <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> shuts down suddenly
threads.message: SOLVED: <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> replaced and everything is good. Cheers fellows

threads.title: MBP <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> shuts down suddenly
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 83652, member: 682"]
Did you test with known good battery?
If still shuts down, then no reason to touch USB-C area.

Does it turn off starting in SMC bypass mode?
Try your USB test macOS too.

Clean ME BIOS worth to try also.
[/QUOTE]
Thank you mate…. Did your advice… turned out to be <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> … replaced it with a new donor (was bad on pads). Thank you:-)
